page.title: 08Occupations in Wytham (2)
page.content: In 1981 in Wytham, no active men between 16 and 64 were unemployed. No details of what occupied men and women between these ages was available. Our information was obtained by talking to people in the village. Men still work on the farms; the forester and the keeper look after the woods but now the sawmill, the field station and the laboratory provide new occupations. People also work outside the village in highly skilled jobs. There is a vicar not a curate in the parish; the innkeeper has at least 6 staff. Wytham has no school, but 2 teachers live in the village and teach elsewhere. An author, several university dons, some students, a hairdresser, a postwoman, the keeper of The Ashmolean Museum, all live in the village, but in 1985 there are 31 people of "pensionable age".
